item.title: FroyoScape's Classed/Series Minigames Concept - Includes an idea on how to add!
item.dc:creator: @enzo42 enzo42
item.description:
@enzo42 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:8, topic:478975”][quote author=enzo42 link=topic=597192.msg4205398#msg4205398 date=1358872660]

public boolean isInMinigame() { if (absX >= 1233 && absX <= 2819 && absY >= 1728 && absY <= 9821) return true; return false; }

Why not use something like this instead?

public boolean isInMinigame() { return (absX >= 1233 && absX <= 2819 && absY >= 1728 && absY <= 9821); }
[/quote]

Your [tt]abstract[/tt] class should be an [tt]interface[/tt], you should also read up on abstraction and interfacing more before using it.

Your boolean’s can be simplified to a single statement.

And always, always, always use [tt]@Override[/tt] when implementing methods from the parent class!

@Clawz thanks for? Thanks for saying it or ?[/quote]

Yea I don’t read comments sorry

Read full topic

item.title: FroyoScape's Classed/Series Minigames Concept - Includes an idea on how to add!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[center][size=24pt][tt]FroyoScape’s[/tt] Classed/Series Minigames Concept[/size][/center]

First of all, I’d like to thank everyone who supports FroyoScape - A taste of Frogurt. Second of all, we need a modeller to make this reality. Actually, for the server overall.

It began with the idea of a Demonic minigame. It extended into inspiration of making a server. This concept was the inspiriation of FroyoScape. This concept can be yours too.

I’d love to introduce you all to my very first idea in FroyoScape, a classed minigames concept. Some for the wrost, some for the best. A best of both worlds. Some for those who are middle classed and are looking for excruciating results. A best of three worlds. Some for those who just want to have fun. A best of four worlds. This classed minigame system can build a community together for competition, a true competition. And I’d like to share it to you all, the MoparScape community.

The system (Includes an idea of how to add it!)

There are four custom made npcs. Those npcs will be called Reuniclus, Demonica, Everus, and Olympia. All four NPCs will control four series minigames. To be decided on what they will do for minigames.

Nerdy tip: Make an abstract class and extend the series! Example:

package server.model.minigame.reuniclus;

public abstract Reuniclus {

	public absract int minigameTime();
	public abstract void minigameInterface();
	public abstract void minigameStart();
	public abstract void minigame();
	public abstract void minigameEnd();
	public abstract boolean isInMinigame();
	public abstract boolean isInWaiting();

}
package server.model.minigame.reuniclus;

public class Reuniclussiality extends Reuniclus {

	public int minigameTime() {
		return 10;
	}

	public void minigameInterface() {
		c.getPA().setWalkableInterface(INTERFACEID);
	}

	public void minigameStart() {
		c.sendMessage("Starting minigame!");
	}

	public void minigame() {
		/*What happens during minigame.*/
	}

	public void minigameEnd() {
		c.sendMessage("Ending minigame!");
	}

	public boolean isInMinigame() {
		if (absX >= 1233 && absX <= 2819 && absY >= 1728 && absY <= 9821)
			return true;
		return false;
	}

	public boolean isInWaiting() {
		if (absX >= 1290 && absX <= 2821 && absY >= 2198 && absY <= 2318)
			return true;
		return false;
	}

}

Newbies Class: Reuniclus i[/i]
Reuniclus is a special minigame for levels 20 - 40s. Reuniclus’s series:

[ul][li]ReUni[/li][/ul]

I know, the names suck.

ReUni

[quote=“arham 4”]Well me and Amy have been working on ReUni, a minigame for FroyoScape. We got the idea of there being a beast that has a sword and a shield. The shield will be randomized. Electric, Water, and Fire is what has been thought. The player must utilize the weapon they get or use magic to defeat this enemy. Here is the following chart for the supper effectiveness of the weapons to shield:

Layout:
SHIELD <- Weapon/mage style

Legend:
Not effective
Neutral
Super effective

Electric <- Earth
Electric <- Fire
Electric <- Ice
Electric <- Electric

Earth <- Water
Earth <- Ice
Earth <- Electric
Earth <- Fire

Fire <- Earth
Fire <- Electric
Fire <- Fire
Fire <- Ice[/quote]


Middle Class: Everus i[/i]

[ul][li]Mount Everus[/li]
[li]Eventurous[/li][/ul]

Mount Everus
Setting: To be decided
Goal/Aim: Mount Everus is a ‘Race to the Finish’ minigame. In the minigame, you recieve points for each step you take. The points name are, of course, Everus Points, and they may be used in the minigame only. There will be an item named Portable Everus Exchange. In it, the player may buy items such as barricades to block other users. Whoever reaches the top wins.
Reward: 20k + Misc.random(4,000)

Eventurous
Setting: A far away island
Goal/Aim: Eventorous is propably the most epic minigame of these class minigames. You have seen this right?

Well, this will come to reality. The statues in the side are actually real monsters. It is up to the player to escape them. This will be team work. Here is a tip from me for this minigame:

[ul][li]Atleast 2 tanks[/li]
[li]Atleast 3 attackers[/li]
[li]Atleast 1 racer (A person who trys to get to the end of the island while the other monsters are distracted)[/li][/ul]

Of course, they won’t be assigned. The team has to decide themselves in the waiting room.
Rewards: 10k + Misc.random(5,000) to every team mate.

Middle Class: Demonica i[/i]

[ul][li]Demonic Dungeon[/li][/ul]

Demonic Dungeon
Well, think of Demonic Dungeon as your CS Portable. There are two things in this minigame.

The Tutorial - The tutorial of course teaches you the basics of the game. The basics of the game are the following:

[ul][li]Being in the game gives you one point per 10 seconds. If you are in the enemy base then you get two points.[/li]
[li]There are multiple kinds of things that give you points.[/li][list]
[li]Normal Monsters - Killing a normal monster gives you either[/li][list]
[li]0 demonic points[/li]
[li]1 demonic point[/li]
[li]5 demonic points[/li]
[li]6 demonic points[/li]
[li]12 demonic points[/li]
[li]13 demonic points[/li]
[li]15 demonic points[/li]
[li]17 demonic points[/li]
[li]20 demonic points[/li]
[/list]
[li]Boss Monsters - Boss monsters are special monsters that, when they are spawned, the camera angle turns to them (This is actually unsure). Boss monsters give you even more points, points such as:[/li][list]
[li]30 demonic points[/li]
[li]60 demonic points[/li]
[li]70 demonic points[/li]
[li]140 demonic points[/li]
[li]170 demonic points[/li]
[/list]
[li]Staying In-game - If you are in the game you get one point per 10 seconds. You get two points if you are in the enemy base.[/li]
[/list]
[li]Use the points to buy weapons IN-GAME! You may not use the points as a reward outside the game. If anyone may suggest items, we may give ‘prizes’.[/li]
[li]Have fun! Enjoy the random monsters saying random, dumb things such as, “Who’s the noob now,” and such.[/li][/ul]

The Game - Basically everything stated above.

Higher Class: Olympia i[/i]
To be announced everything…

Read full topic
